WorkItem.Description:
The Project Wizard at "Choose the Poject folder" "Custom" option does not tkae the directory that I input, but continues to use the string "Custom" etc. as the folder to work in.

If I use another option, say "User Folder" the project is properly assembled there. If I then move the folder to my SharpDevelop working directory this message is returned " Access to the path 'Custom\MyAssembly\MyAssembly' is denied. | UnauthorizedAccessException | Void WinIOError(Int32, System.String)"

Surely "Custom" should be replaced with the input directory name?

Regards
